alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 01 at 9:26AM AKST until March 01 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. North winds gusting to 45 mph around Seward Wednesday morning. Reduced visibility as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Whittier and Seward. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As an area of low pressure passes east of Seward early this morning, northerly winds will quickly increase, peaking mid-morning before slowly diminishing late this afternoon. Snow will likely be fluffy, and windy conditions will significantly reduce visibility and create snow drifts. Gusty westerly winds will also develop for Portage Valley and Whittier this afternoon and persist through Thursday allowing to another round of blowing snow. The blowing snow will likely cause reduced visibilities to persist for these locations through Thursday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
